most_active_tickets.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
I'm unable to do Handshake with asana
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
Visual Studio 2022 extension interfering with Diagnostic tool output
Copilot is not giving any feedback
Bug: unable to cancel the download of an LLLM

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop and Copilot not responding after update
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop app failing to launch or Copilot not responding after updating to recent versions on Windows and Linux. Issues include app stuck on loading screen, Copilot failing to respond in conversations or extensions, and inability to install local LLM models. Troubleshooting steps like restarting, reinstalling, and checking logs have not resolved the problems. Further investigation is needed to identify the root cause and provide a solution.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Copilot not responding
related_issues.text:
Copilot not responding
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS: 11.3.3 - Pieces for Developers: 4.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey all,
Pieces Copilot no longer responds in conversations in the app, or through any of the extensions (VS Code/Chrome). It just keeps loading. I've tried hard-resetting, restarting, reinstalling, On-Device LLMs, and Cloud LLMs. The weird thing is, some of the conversations will have a summary or will update the name of the conversation, but it never responds in the chat. I looked at the logs and saw repeated Sentry Event Errors, but not sure what to do with that.  I attached the log file from the day before yesterday (yesterday's is too large and won't upload). What should I do?

Thanks!

[log-04292025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19997109/log-04292025.txt)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Integrations Failing
common_issues.description: Users report various failures in Pieces OS and integrations like Asana and Copilot. Issues include Handshake failures with Asana, login failures with a 500 error on /os/sign_in, and Copilot unresponsiveness despite conversation summaries updating.  Suggested troubleshooting includes checking logs for errors, ensuring valid model versions, and verifying network connectivity.

related_issues.title: I'm unable to do Handshake with asana
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop/OS fails to launch or connect due to invalid port or dependency issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces for Developers hanging during startup or login, encountering "Invalid port" errors, or failing to launch despite Pieces OS running. Issues appear on Windows and Linux, across various application versions.  Suggested solutions include checking Pieces OS logs for port information, ensuring Pieces OS is running before launching the Desktop app, and reinstalling the Desktop application.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Issues on Windows
common_issues.description: Multiple users report Pieces for Developers components malfunctioning on Windows. Issues include Visual Studio extension blanking diagnostic tools, Copilot unresponsiveness in the app and extensions, and Desktop app failing to launch past "Ensure Core Dependencies" after update.  Suggested troubleshooting includes disabling/reinstalling extensions, checking logs, restarting applications and system, and ensuring Pieces OS is running correctly.

related_issues.title: Visual Studio 2022 extension interfering with Diagnostic tool output
related_issues.text: Visual Studio 2022 extension interfering with Diagnostic tool output ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Visual Studio ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version PiecesOS 11.3.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. The Diagnostic tools pane that, by default, opens when you begin debugging in Visual Studio ends up entirely blank with the Pieces plugin enabled in Visual Studio Version 17.14.0 Preview 4.0. Disabling the plugin restores the Diagnostic tools output. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. common_issues.title: Local and Cloud LLM Model Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with both locally hosted and cloud-based LLMs.  Symptoms include failure to install local models, Copilot unresponsiveness, and continuous loading.  A common error message points to a 404 for the Gemini Pro model.  Suggested troubleshooting includes checking model validity and project access.

Hey all,
Pieces Copilot no longer responds in conversations in the app, or through any of the extensions (VS Code/Chrome). It just keeps loading. I've tried hard-resetting, restarting, reinstalling, On-Device LLMs, and Cloud LLMs. The weird thing is, some of the conversations will have a summary or will update the name of the conversation, but it never responds in the chat. I looked at the logs and saw repeated Sentry Event Errors, but not sure what to do with that.  I attached the log file from the day before yesterday (yesterday's is too large and won't upload). What should I do?

Thanks!

[log-04292025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19997109/log-04292025.txt)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "Pieces Desktop not Launching" issue (648) due to its high activity level and impact on Windows users.
Investigate the Asana handshake failure (702) and the OS login issue (691) as they affect integrations and core functionality.
Address the recurring Copilot unresponsiveness (701, 584) across different platforms and applications.
Troubleshoot local LLM installation failures (700) and investigate the reported 404 error for the Gemini Pro model.
Review the Visual Studio extension issue (697) to minimize disruption for Windows users.
Examine the "Invalid port" error (641) affecting Linux users and ensure clear documentation on port settings.
Consider updating documentation or FAQs with troubleshooting steps for common issues like application launch failures and Copilot unresponsiveness.
Monitor error logs and Sentry events for patterns and prioritize bug fixes based on frequency and impact.
Gather more data on user environments and application versions to identify potential correlations with reported issues.
Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds to users through release notes or community forums.
Implement better error handling and reporting mechanisms to capture more detailed information for faster debugging.
Improve internal communication and collaboration between support and development teams for quicker resolution times.
Develop automated tests to identify and prevent regressions related to common issues.
Consider creating dedicated support channels for different applications (Desktop, OS, VS Code extension) to streamline issue tracking.
Analyze user feedback and prioritize feature requests based on user needs and pain points.
Regularly review and update support documentation and tutorials to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Provide training to support staff on common issues, troubleshooting steps, and internal tools.
Implement a system for tracking and prioritizing bug fixes based on severity and user impact.
Encourage users to submit detailed bug reports with steps to reproduce the issue and relevant logs.
Establish service level agreements (SLAs) for different types of support requests to manage user expectations.
Regularly analyze support metrics (e.g., resolution time, customer satisfaction) to identify areas for improvement.
Invest in tools and resources to automate support tasks and improve team efficiency.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the support team through regular feedback and training.
Explore options for self-service support resources like FAQs, knowledge bases, and community forums.
Proactively identify and address potential issues before they impact a large number of users.
